projectDesc.p: "山亭柳" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the Tune “Willows by the Mountain Pavilion”
My family lives in Qin in the west,
gambling and gaming are the skills I carry along.
In the world of “flowers and willows,” I win by novelty.
Occasionally I imitate the tunes of Niannu,
sometimes my voice can stop the floating clouds.
I have countless Shu brocade wrapping around my head,
For years I have been traveling between Xianyang and the capital.
The leftover wine and cold food vainly consume my soul.
Things deep at my heart, to whom can I confide?
If someone who appreciates would choose me,
I would willingly sing every one of the finest songs.
A song at the banquet, my tears roll down.
Once again, I cover my face with the silk kerchief.
